page.title: 12MOTTRAM -Housing
page.content: The original village was situated on top of the hill near to the church. No visible remains exist of the structure apart from uneven areas of ground. As the turnpike roads were built and as industry came to the valley houses were needed for the influx of workers. The older weaving cottages were used as lodging houses, but the local quarries were able to provide good supplies of gritstone for both building and tiling. This allowed the rapid development of stone built cottages, which give a characteristic feure of the area to this day.
